head.supplied: 16/5/90. ¶ ¶ It is always a red-letter day for me, dear Mr Holtze, when a collection arrives from you. And this time the consignment is particularly important not only in rarities, but also in novelt...

div.p: GRG 19/391, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: The source is a series of un-numbered pages of plant identifications, concluding with a dated letter commencing below a list of numbers. The specimens being treated are those numbered from 986-1100, announced in M. Holtze to M, 24 April 1890. Numbers 986, 987, 992, 1000, 1033, 1041, 1048-9, 1075, 1082, 1087, 1091-3 and 1100 are not now in MEL. Numbers 1053, 1061-2, and 1095-96 are not listed in any known communication from M to Holtze and are not in MEL. Some of the numbers in this series had been previously used. Specimens now in MEL numbered 998, collected in 1889, and 999, collected in 1886, are different species than the ones in this sequence, and 1054, collected 1889, is the same species as that dated 1890 included under that number in the shipment. The specimens in this series still at MEL are all dated 1890 (AVH, accessed 2 June 2022).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: There are some pages where the record numbers dealt with are not sequential, with some considerably out of sequence. This is not inconsistent with M's comment below that 'While unpacking the plant specimens I have immediately written down for you the generic name of most of them and frequently also the species name'. It is possible that the unpacking did not follow the sequence of numbers. The sequence given here is the best fit deduced from mapping the numbers given on each page. The position of page breaks is given in the notes. What is transcribed as the last two pages could be inserted after record number 1030, but the tone of the comments in the narrative text suggests that the box had been fully unpacked before the text was written.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: M returned to some of the species a second time at a later date and dealt with others in a separate letter; these cases are indicated in the notes.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: Diese Pflanze sehe ich jetzt zum ersten mal. Sie ist nur bisher aus Sir Jos. Banks Sammlung bekannt, u einzig vom Endeavour River.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Qld.

p.seg: Reife Frucht ist auch nicht in seiniger Sammlung; ist die Wurzel tiefer unten etwa knollig? Ein guter Vorrath für Austausch Zwecke wäre von dieser Seltenheit recht erwünscht!

p.style: font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;
p.seg: [I am seeing this plant here for the first time. Until now it has been known only from Sir Joseph Banks' collection, and only from the Endeavour River. There is no ripe fruit in his collection either; does the root by any chance have tubers lower down? A good supply of this rarity would be very desirable for exchange purposes!]

cell.style: padding-left: 0.075in; padding-right: 0.075in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: Wohl nur Zwerg-Form von D. Indica. Sollte die frische Blume verschieden aussehen und auch die Samen verschieden sein, dann bitte ich ein Ex. in Alcohol.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;
p.seg: . But if the fresh flowers should look different and the seed are also different, I ask for a specimen in alcohol.]

note.p: Record number 802 is dated to 1889. In M to M. Holtze, 1889 (in this edition as 89-00-00p), M tentatively identified it as Verbenaceae and asked for further specimens. In M to M. Holtze, June 1890 (in this edition as 90-06-00a), it and 995 are identified as Clerodendrum holtzei, but published as Clerodendron holtzei in B91.05.07, p. 75.

p.seg: Bisher kannten wir diese Art innerhalb der Tropen nur aus hohen Gebirgswässern. Ihre Art mit gezähnten Blättern ist N. gigantea; die andere N. stellata. Sie werden finden, dass auch die reifen Samen von allen dreien verschieden sind.
Die rothen Varietäten sind bisher sehr wenig in Cultur

p.style: font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;
p.seg: [Until now we knew this species only from high altitude mountain waters within the tropics. Your species with dentate leaves is
. You will find that the ripe seeds of all three differ from each other as well. So far the red varieties are found very rarely in culture]

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: Es ist immer für mich ein Freudentag, lieber Herr Holtze, wenn eine Sammlung von Ihnen ankommt, u dies mal ist die Zusendung besonders wichtig nicht nur in Seltenheiten sondern auch in Neuheiten. Dann sind auch die Exemplare sehr schön und meistens vollständig; u. ferner haben Sie ja auch eine reichliche

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: End of page.

p.seg: Menge von Samen gesandt, welche für rurale Zwecke besonders zu Statten kommen.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: Ich habe beim Herausnehmen der Pflanzen Exemplare gleich von den meisten den Genus-Namen für Sie niedergeschrieben u oft auch den Species-Namen. Bald soll Auskunft über das Zurückgelegte folgen. Es ist prächtig, dass Sie einen jungen Sohn haben, der flink und scharfsehend das Sammeln mit übernehmen kann. Ich werde seine Hülfe in meinen Werken besonders anerkennen. Ganz besonders dankbar bin ich für die so sorgfältig in Alcohol geschickten geschickten

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: Materialien. Doch habe ich noch keins der Fläschchen geöffnet.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;

div.p: Sie ehrend und Ihnen alles Gute wünschend

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Sentence is a marginal addition on the first page with narrative text.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: Wenn Sie die dortigen Bambuse in Ihren Garten versetzen u
, z. B. mit menschlichen Excrementen, so würden Sie die Pflanzen zur

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Sentence is a marginal addition on the second page with narrative text.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p: It is always a red-letter day for me, dear Mr Holtze, when a collection arrives from you. And this time the consignment is particularly important not only in rarities, but also in novelties. In addition the specimens are very beautiful and mostly complete. Furthermore you have sent a generous quantity of seed, which comes in especially handy for rural purposes.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p:
While unpacking the plant specimens I have immediately written down for you the generic name of most of them and frequently also the species name. Information on those I laid aside will follow soon. It is splendid, that you have a young son,
Nicholas Holtze. who is quick and has a sharp eye and can take over part of the collecting. I shall acknowledge his help especially in my publications. I am particularly grateful for the material so carefully sent in alcohol; however, I have not yet opened any of the little bottles.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p: Rendering you my respects and wishing you all the best

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; line-height: 0.1945in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p:
In Eulophia the attachment of the pollen masses in particular needs to be examined.
In M to M. Holtze, 12 June 1889, M had requested additional specimens of another Eulophia , preserved in alcohol to allow the attachment to be better determined.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; line-height: 0.1945in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p: If you were to transplant your bamboo species from there into your garden and manure them heavily , for example with human excrements, you would get the plants to develop flowers .
